Complete Topic - Crossroads: Experiments in Appreciating Difference 
Meeting 9/3, 10/1, 10/22, 11/12, 12/3
The goal of this course is to help students actively cultivate an appreciation of difference and variation in the world around them. Using neuroscience and philosophy, we will dive deeper into the neural and conceptual bases that engender different worldviews and ways of being in the world. This course will explore concepts such as creativity, imagination, empathy, service, mindfulness, and nature. Each session will be an experiment in engaging difference through interactions with common places and things. Students will have the opportunity to explore the greater Atlanta area while gaining an understanding of how to effectively contribute to various communities in ways that correspond to each student's unique values, interests, skills, and passions.
course_description: A side-car course brings together a subset of students from two courses that overlap in methodologies, topics, etc., to create a short interdisciplinary course that runs simultaneously with its two sponsoring courses. One credit, S/U only. Schedule and format arranged by sponsoring professors.
